snippet: A decision to fire Scott Forstall, the leader of mobile software development, means the departure of a high-ranking proponent of the visual design style for software favored by Steve Jobs.
abstract: Management shake-up at Apple will likely mean a shift away from visual software tricks that mimic real-world materials, aesthetic long championed by Steven P Jobs; shift toward more minimal style could significantly impact company, which puts design at center of its identity.

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and NICK BILTON

lead_paragraph: A decision to fire Scott Forstall, the leader of mobile software development, means the departure of a high-ranking proponent of the visual design style for software favored by Steve Jobs.

headline.main: Apple Shake-Up Could Lead to Design Shift
headline.print_headline: Apple Shake-Up Could Mean End to Real-World Images in Software
